definition.description: Stores verses saved by the user. This subcollection enforces path-based ownership, ensuring that only the owner can access their verses.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

params.name: userVerseId
params.description: Unique ID of the saved verse.

definition.description: Stores the Shloka of the Day.  The `date` field is used to query for the current day's shloka.

params.name: dailyShlokaId
params.description: Unique ID of the daily shloka entry.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support a mobile-first application for Sanskrit verse analysis and personalization. It leverages denormalization to ensure authorization independence and structural segregation for simplified security rules.  Specifically, the `UserVerse` collection is placed under each user's document (`/users/{userId}/userVerses/{userVerseId}`) to ensure path-based ownership, simplifying security rules and guaranteeing that only the owning user can access their saved verses. This eliminates the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules and allows for secure list operations.  The `verses` collection stores all verses, while the `dailyShlokas` collection stores the shloka of the day, identified by date.
